reason: MOTI already designing new structure
notes: Preliminary designs completed but under review for improved design by MOTI

reason: Important connector to Tyhee Lake
notes: Preliminary designs complete and include habitat restoration compoents. Designs require internal review by MOTI to finalize

reason: Scores as barrier but likely passable to most fish species and life stages. Channel has become heavily ingrown with canary reedgrass and needs restoration before addressing this crossing. Reassess once downstream crossing and habitat issues have been addresesd
Low quality habitat and dry stream for most of the year. Recommend as non-actionable
notes: Poorly constructed/maintained road with rip rap directly obstructing  culvert.

reason: Very important salmon stream historically for Hagwilget. Legacy barrier has resulted in major salmon declines in watershed
notes: Several preliminary  designs completed but no political will to move this project forward from MOTI's side

reason: "low hanging fruit" upstream of hgihway
notes: Slow  moving almost wetland like stream. Deep glides throughout. Moderate to high stagnant water often smelling of sulfur. Lots of healthy riparian veeg. Apperas to have v. unstable flows.

reason: 100% backwatered and likely passable to most fish species and life stages
notes: Recommend leaving until end of life cycle, potentially move timeline up as part of larger subwatershed restoration campaign.

reason: Complete barrier to fish passage
notes: Scheduled for replacement by MOTI in next 2-3 years

reason: Relatively easy fix for a MOTI road
notes: Preliminary designs complete, require internal review by MOTI to finalize. Passable to most adult fish but may be a low flow barrier. Passability for juvenile fish unknown.

reason: Considered important migration corridor with moderate juvenile rearing potential
Likely a full barrier to passage. Good habitat upstream, Coho captured downstream but not upstream.
Important migration corridor with suitable spawning habitat and moderate rearing potential.
notes: recommend advancing to priority barriers list.

reason: Perched culvert under deep fill. Medium quality habitat. Recommend as non-actionable
notes: Heavily trampled by cattle. Suitable overwintering and rearing habitat with occasional spawning habitat. 0.65 m rock drop 365 m upstream likely barrier for juveniles but not adults. Dogwood Enviro Consultants looking at ways to exclude cattle from riparian. Some low flow issues. Historic sightings of adult Coho and Steelhead between 195943 and here. No modeled key habitat upstream

reason: Relatively easy fix for a MOTI road
notes: Preliminary designs complete, require internal review by MOTI to finalize.

reason: Culvert at end of life cycle and needs replacing.
notes: Stream needs work downstream to prevent dewatering. DFO pursuing options with MOTI. Passable to most salmon and life stages but velocity barrier at high flows and may be too shallow for adults at low flows.

reason: High quality habitat with high potential habitat gains
notes: Major barrier, some flooding issues upstream also needs addressing. Aim for completion in next 5-10 years.

reason: Very high quality habitat, current culvert affected by regular dredging and sediment buildup
notes: Preliminary design was completed 2020 but no timeline for finalizing and completing upgrades

reason: Culvert at end of life and needs replacing. Very high quality habitat.
notes: Preliminary designs complete but don't meet CN standards. Further conversations with CN required. Cost of replacement will depend on preferred structure/solution

reason: Discuss deferring to end of life cycle
notes: Large culvert. Dolly Varden captured upstream and downstream. High quality habitat but glaciated and unlikely to support salmon.

reason: Abundant fish present, non-highway barrier
notes: Initial contact with landowner seemed open to replacement; however, landowner became unresponsive in 2021. Continue to work with landowner for potential solution

reason: Need to determine status of CN Rail crossing downstream before proceeding to design
notes: Fish observed in outlet pool

reason: Passable to all life stages and species but may be slight barrier during high flows. Recommend as non-actionable.
Passable. Fully backwatered and embedded concrete box.
Past backwatering work conducted. Pink Salmon present at fences upstream.
notes: High quality habitat with moderate cover. Monitor for continued passage functionality; aim for replacement at end of culvert life.

reason: Canyon downstream acts as low flow barrier for steelhead and full barrier to Coho. Locally important to Witset and as a steelhead stream.
Low quality habitat. Consider deferring to end of life cycle
notes: Water over allocation issues in stream, signs of sedimentation from adjacent land uses. Dewatered at time of survey
Abundant juveniles observed upstream

reason: Currently passable to adult fish but could be barrier to some juveniles. Conditions could degrade over time.
notes: Excellent habitat up to impassable falls.

reason: Barrier to fish passage. Currently a double culvert with blockages in one culvert.
notes: Coho spotted upstream
